 mining and minerals subsidiary of CSR Limited in the late 1960s to early 1970s.  This work identified the 
 presence  of  economic  bauxite  occurrences  with  broad  spaced  drilling  returning  intersection  of  2.4 
 metres  at  31.6%  extractable  Al2O3  and  2.4  metres  at  31.3%  extractable  Al2O3.    From  this  drilling 
 Pacminex estimated a Non-JORC compliant resource of 13 million tonnes at 29.5% extractable Al2O3 and 
 During  the  reporting  period  Bauxite  Resources  Limited  conducted  a  comprehensive  literature  search, 
 data review and target generation phase.  Results of this work indicate that potential exists for several 
 additional  zones  of  bauxite  mineralisation  significantly  increase  the  target  size  defined  by  Pacminexs 
 Bauxite Resources Limited plans to conduct systematic exploration of all areas of bauxitic laterite over

11.text: In  June  1975  CSR  Ltd  conducted  a  critical  reviewed  the  Pacminex  exploration  program  and  resource

12.text: modelling.    Based  on  new  metallurgical  data  CSR  believed  that  Pacminex  overstated  the  size  of  the

13.text: resource/reserves for the entire Chittering/Muchea Project by 35% because of the following factors.

14.text: •  Based  on  metallurgical  results  received  in  1971/1972,  CSR  attributed  a  10%  loss  of

15.text: alumina  due  to  re-precipitation  of  alumina  to  red  residual  mud  instead  of  the 5%  loss

21.text: regression based on results from Area 3.

22.text: •  CSR excluded marginal and high silica blocks included by Pacminex.

text:
In  June  1975  CSR  Ltd  conducted  a  critical  reviewed  the  Pacminex  exploration  program  and  resource 
 modelling.    Based  on  new  metallurgical  data  CSR  believed  that  Pacminex  overstated  the  size  of  the 
 resource/reserves for the entire Chittering/Muchea Project by 35% because of the following factors. 
 •  Based  on  metallurgical  results  received  in  1971/1972,  CSR  attributed  a  10%  loss  of 
 alumina  due  to  re-precipitation  of  alumina  to  red  residual  mud  instead  of  the 5%  loss 
 •  CSR used a 10% lower extractable alumina value than that calculated by drill indicated 
 analysis,  whereas  Pacminex  used  a  5%  lower  extractable  alumina  value  than  that 
 calculated by drill indicated analysis. 
 •  CSR  revised  the  regression  for  each  prospect  area,  whereas  Pacminex  use  a  single 
 regression based on results from Area 3. 
 •  CSR excluded marginal and high silica blocks included by Pacminex. 
  CSR excluded material beneath 6m. 
 It should be noted that CSR was comparing Pacminex’s resource estimate of 234 million tonnes at 30.9% 
 extractable  Al2O3  and  3.2%  soluble  SiO2  with  CSR  reserves  estimates  of  146  million  tonnes  at  30.0% 
 extractable Al2O3.  The 1971 Pacminex estimated 136 million tonnes of reserves derived from the 234 
 One  of  the  areas  tested  in  the  Muchea  Project  was  Area  19  that  falls  partly  on  E70/3007  and  work 
 Pacminex  completed  surface  mapping  and  sampling  that  defined  15  square  kilometres  of  potentially 
 bauxitic laterite derived from the weathering of schists, metasediments and quartzites.  Thin blankets of 
 sand and clayish loam commonly form overburden to the bauxites occurrences. 
 A total of 162 vacuum holes for 723 metres were drilled on a 200 yard by 300 yard grid pattern to test 
 42%  of  bauxitic  laterites  identified  by  mapping.    Of  these  75  holes  for  314  metres  were  drilled  on 
 E70/3007 (Figure 2). Significant results from Pacminex vacuum holes are shown on Table 2.
